受.definition: to receive; to accept; to suffer; subjected to; to bear; to stand; pleasant; (passive marker); (LGBT) bottom

受不了.definition: unbearable; unable to endure; can't stand

受事.definition: object (of a transitive verb); to receive a task

受保人.definition: the insured person; the person covered by an insurance policy

受傷.definition: to sustain injuries; wounded (in an accident etc); harmed

受僱.definition: to be employed; to be hired; hired; paid

受凍挨餓.definition: see 挨餓受凍|挨饿受冻[ai2e4-shou4dong4]

受刑人.definition: person being executed; victim of corporal punishment; person serving a sentence

受到.definition: to receive (praise, an education, punishment etc); to be ...ed (praised, educated, punished etc)

受制.definition: to be controlled (by sb); to suffer under a yoke

受命.definition: ordained or appointed to a post; to benefit from counsel

受命於天.definition: to be emperor by the grace of heaven; to have the mandate of heaven

受夠.definition: to have had enough of; to be fed up with; to have had one's fill of

受夾板氣.definition: to be attacked by both sides in a quarrel; to be caught in the crossfire

受害.definition: to suffer damage, injury etc; damaged; injured; killed; robbed

受害者.definition: casualty; victim; those injured and wounded

受寒.definition: affected by cold; to catch cold

受審.definition: to stand trial; to be on trial (for a crime)

受寵.definition: to receive favor (from superior); favored; pampered

受寵若驚.definition: overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)

受封.definition: to receive fief and title; to be enfeoffed; (fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor

受得了.definition: to put up with; to endure

受戒.definition: to take oaths as a monk (Buddhism); to take orders

受教.definition: to receive instruction; to benefit from advice

受暑.definition: to suffer heatstroke; to suffer heat exhaustion

受業.definition: to study; to learn from a master; (pupil's first person pronoun) I, your student

受氣.definition: to be mistreated; to be bullied

受法律保護權.pinyin: shòu fǎ lǜ bǎo hù quán

受潮.definition: to get moist; to get damp (due to humidity, seepage etc)

受災.definition: disaster-stricken; to be hit by a natural calamity

受理.definition: to accept to hear a case; to handle (a service)

受癟.definition: discomfited; to get into a mess

受盡.definition: to suffer enough from; to suffer all kinds of; to have one's fill of

受禮.definition: to accept a gift; to acknowledge greetings

受窘.definition: embarrassed; bothered; in an awkward position

受精.definition: to be fertilized; to be inseminated

受累.definition: to be put to a lot of trouble

受罪.definition: to endure; to suffer; hardships; torments; a hard time; a nuisance

受聘.definition: hired (for employment); invited (e.g. to lecture); engaged (for a task); (in olden times) betrothal gift from the groom's family

受聽.definition: nice to hear; worth listening to

受胎.definition: to become pregnant; to conceive; impregnated; insemination

受託.definition: to be entrusted; to be commissioned

受訪.definition: to give an interview; to be interviewed; to respond to (questions, a survey etc)

受訪者.definition: participant in a survey; interviewee; respondent

受試者.definition: subject (in an experiment); participant (in a clinical trial etc)

受過.definition: to take the blame (for sb else)

受阻.definition: to be obstructed; to be hindered

受限.definition: to be limited; to be restricted; to be constrained

受難.definition: to suffer a calamity; to suffer (e.g. under torture); distress

受難者.definition: sufferer; a victim of a calamity; a person in distress

受騙.definition: to be cheated; to be taken in; to be hoodwinked
